title: Updating the package
text: Run devtools::test(). Run devtools::check(). Run use_version() select new version, commit. Update NEWS.md. branch: Commit NEWS.md DESCRIPTION. Merge branch main. Create merge commit, don’t squash, don’t fast-forward. Amend merge commit’s message automatic one used. small single-commit patch: Commit everything directly main. Push. Set push version tag:
code: devtools::load_all() version <- packageVersion('blabr') cmd <- glue::glue('tag {version} && git push --tags') system2('git', glue::glue('tag {version}')) system2('git', 'push --tags')

title: Updating the package
text: renaming removing functions, hard-deprecate - make defunct. Create section next blabr version R/defunct.R move old function . See file examples.

Add LENA stats to each interval in a dataframe — add_lena_stats
text: its_xml XML object created rlena::read_its_file. intervals tibble columns depending time_type: wall: interval_start, interval_end (POSIXct), interval_start_wav (ms) wav: interval_start_wav, interval_end_wav (ms since wav start) Can contain columns. time_type Either wall wav. wall (default), expects columns interval_start, interval_end (POSIXct timestamps), interval_start_wav (milliseconds since wav start). calculate interval_end_wav dynamically drop output. wav, expects interval_start_wav interval_end_wav (milliseconds since wav start).

title: Add LENA stats to each interval in a dataframe — add_lena_stats
text: intervals three new columns: cvc, ctc, awc. Missing values replaced 0 intervals without segments.

title: Add LENA stats to each interval in a dataframe — add_lena_stats
text: segments overlapping intervals allocated proportionally based overlap duration. segment overlaps multiple intervals, contributes proportionally based overlap length. difference function calculate_lena_like_stats latter calculates exactly stats every five minute period wall time (e.g., 13:00-13:05). rewritten first create intervals use add_lena_stats avoid code repetition (see issue #).

what: Assigns binned fixations to specified time windows — assign_time_windows
title: Assigns binned fixations to specified time windows — assign_time_windows
text: Assigns binned fixations specified time windows

title: Assigns binned fixations to specified time windows — assign_time_windows
Assigns binned fixations to specified time windows — assign_time_windows
text: fixation_timeseries fixation timeseries dataframe must contain least following columns: target_onset (numeric): Time target onset milliseconds. time (numeric): Time milliseconds start trial. t_step time step milliseconds. Must match one used fixations_to_timeseries. t_starts numeric vector start times (milliseconds) time windows, relative target onset. value must multiple t_step. length 1, recycled match length t_ends. t_ends numeric vector end times (milliseconds) time windows, relative target onset. value must multiple t_step. length 1, recycled match length t_starts.

title: Assigns binned fixations to specified time windows — assign_time_windows
text: input dataframe following columns added: prewin (factor): Whether time bin comes target onset. Values "Y" "N". window defined t_starts[] t_ends[], following columns added: window_{t_starts[]}_{t_ends[]}ms (factor): Whether time bin window t_starts[] t_ends[] milliseconds target onset. Values "Y" "N". which_window_{t_starts[]}_{t_ends[]}ms (factor): Indicates whether time bin window (labeled "t_startsi_t_endsims"), comes target onset ("pre"), neither ("neither"). t_onset (numeric): Time (milliseconds) target onset rounded nearest multiple t_step.

title: Assigns binned fixations to specified time windows — assign_time_windows
text: function assigns time bin fixation_timeseries specified time windows defined t_starts t_ends relative target onset. window, creates two new columns: window_{start}_{end}ms: Indicates whether time bin falls within window start end milliseconds target onset. Values "Y" "N". which_window_{start}_{end}ms: Indicates whether time bin window (labeled "start_endms"), comes target onset ("pre"), neither ("neither"). Time bins located exactly t_starts[] t_ends[] included corresponding window (.e., intervals inclusive endpoints). function also adds prewin column indicating whether time bin comes target onset. t_onset column computed time target onset, rounded nearest multiple t_step. want use default BLab time windows, set t_starts 360 t_ends DEFAULT_WINDOWS_UPPER_BOUNDS.

title: Defunct functions — defunct
code: # Deprecated in 0.22.0 -------------------------------------  load_tsv(fixrep_path, val_guess_max = 1e+05)  fixations_report(   fixrep_path,   val_guess_max = 1e+05,   remove_unfinished = TRUE,   remove_practice = TRUE )  binifyFixations(   gaze,   binSize = 20,   keepCols = c("Subject", "TrialNumber", "Target", "T"),   maxTime = NULL )  get_windows(   fix_mes_age,   bin_size = 20,   nb_1 = 18,   short_window_time = DEFAULT_WINDOWS_UPPER_BOUNDS$short,   med_window_time = DEFAULT_WINDOWS_UPPER_BOUNDS$med,   long_window_time = DEFAULT_WINDOWS_UPPER_BOUNDS$long )  FindLowData(gazeData, subsetWin, window_size = NULL, nb_2 = 0, binSize = 20)  RemoveLowData(   gazeData,   subsetWin,   window_size = NULL,   nb_2 = 0,   binSize = 20,   propt = "propt",   timeBin = "timeBin",   Trial = "Trial",   SubjectNumber = "SubjectNumber" )  RemoveFrozenTrials(gazeData, Trial, SubjectNumber, gaze)

what: Convert a dataframe of fixation intervals to an evenly spaced timeseries — fixations_to_timeseries
title: Convert a dataframe of fixation intervals to an evenly spaced timeseries — fixations_to_timeseries
text: fixations first dropped/trimmed t_max set. fixation interval boundaries rounded nearest multiples t_step. fixation row duplicated many time time points (also multiples t_step) falling within rounded intervals. timepoins stored new column time. timepoint falls within multiple fixations, row later fixation kept. timepoint fall within fixations given trial, appear output .

title: Convert a dataframe of fixation intervals to an evenly spaced timeseries — fixations_to_timeseries
Convert a dataframe of fixation intervals to an evenly spaced timeseries — fixations_to_timeseries
text: fixations dataframe must minimally contain following columns: recording_id trial_index uniquely identify trials. t_start, t_end - start end times fixations ms. Use read_*_report, split_*_report, merge_split_reports get dataframe. t_step time step ms. t_max Optional. maximum time ms. Fixations start time removed end time fixations end time set time.

title: Convert a dataframe of fixation intervals to an evenly spaced timeseries — fixations_to_timeseries
text: dataframe similar columns input dataframe many rows. differences columns:0 new column time added contains time points multiples t_step within fixation interval rounded nearest multiple t_step. t_start t_end columns renamed fixation_start fixation_end. fixations may dropped started t_max one time bin shared another fixation.

title: Convert a dataframe of fixation intervals to an evenly spaced timeseries — fixations_to_timeseries

Calculate per-speaker statistics based on the .its file — get_lena_speaker_stats
text: its_xml XML object created rlena::read_its_file. intervals tibble columns depending time_type: wall: interval_start, interval_end (POSIXct), interval_start_wav (ms) wav: interval_start_wav, interval_end_wav (ms since wav start) Can contain columns. time_type Either wall wav. wall (default), expects columns interval_start, interval_end (POSIXct timestamps), interval_start_wav (milliseconds since wav start). calculate interval_end_wav dynamically drop output. wav, expects interval_start_wav interval_end_wav (milliseconds since wav start).

title: Calculate per-speaker statistics based on the .its file — get_lena_speaker_stats
text: tibble following columns: interval columns: intervals input tibble, spkr: speaker identifier LENA adult_word_count: non-zero FA* MA* speakers utterance_count: CH* - sum childUttCnt, everyone else - number conversation segments segment_duration: total duration segments speaker interval

text: functions work, clone seedlings-nouns ~/BLAB_DATA/seedlings-nouns/ first.

title: Load data from the SEEDLingS - Nouns dataset — get_seedlings_nouns
code: get_seedlings_nouns(version = NULL)  get_seedlings_nouns_extra(version = NULL, table)  get_seedlings_nouns_codebook(   version = NULL,   table = c("seedlings-nouns", "regions", "recordings", "sub-recordings") )

title: Load data from the SEEDLingS - Nouns dataset — get_seedlings_nouns
text: version version tag checkout table get_seedlings_nouns_extra, extra table load. One : "regions", "recordings", "sub-recordings". get_seedlings_nouns_codebook, table can also "seedlings-nouns" also default function. See "README.md" details.

title: Load data from the SEEDLingS - Nouns dataset — get_seedlings_nouns
text: get_seedlings_nouns, tibble one annotated noun per row. get_seedlings_nouns_extra, tibble one row per region, recording, sub-recording depending table requested. get_seedlings_nouns_codebook, tibble ono row per column requested table.

title: Load data from the SEEDLingS - Nouns dataset — get_seedlings_nouns
text: get_seedlings_nouns() loads main "seedlings-nouns" table annotated nouns. get_seedlings_nouns_extra() function allows loading additional tables: "regions", "recordings", "sub-recordings". get_seedlings_nouns_codebook() function loads codebooks four tables mentioned . get data every time run script, always supply version argument. get latest version number, run get_latest_version('seedlings-nouns') set version parameter output number, e.g., get_seedlings_nouns(version = 'v1.0.0'). Alternatively, set version parameter, run function, look version number issued warning, set version number. need run function . Bergelson Lab member need use version public, clone seedlings-nouns_private(https://github.com/Bergel sonLab/seedlings-nouns_private) ~/BLAB_DATA/seedlings-nouns_private/. function look private repository supply corresponding private version - one starting "0." ending "-dev". get latest private version, use get_latest_version('seedlings-nouns_private'). Otherwise, look releases section GitHub. version descriptions though basically select version date.

title: Load data from the SEEDLingS - Nouns dataset — get_seedlings_nouns
code: version <- 'v1.0.0' seedlings_nouns <- get_seedlings_nouns(version) #> Error in run_git_command(repo, "fetch --tags --prune --prune-tags"): Expected to find the "seedlings-nouns" repository at the following location: /home/runner/BLAB_DATA/seedlings-nouns. Please clone it. seedlings_nouns_codebook <- get_seedlings_nouns_codebook(version) #> Error in run_git_command(repo, "fetch --tags --prune --prune-tags"): Expected to find the "seedlings-nouns" repository at the following location: /home/runner/BLAB_DATA/seedlings-nouns. Please clone it. seedlings_regions <- get_seedlings_nouns_extra(version, 'regions') #> Error in run_git_command(repo, "fetch --tags --prune --prune-tags"): Expected to find the "seedlings-nouns" repository at the following location: /home/runner/BLAB_DATA/seedlings-nouns. Please clone it. seedlings_regions_codebook <- get_seedlings_nouns_codebook(version,                                                            'recordings') #> Error in run_git_command(repo, "fetch --tags --prune --prune-tags"): Expected to find the "seedlings-nouns" repository at the following location: /home/runner/BLAB_DATA/seedlings-nouns. Please clone it.

title: Load VIHI annotation data — get_vihi_annotations
code: get_vihi_annotations(   version = NULL,   subset = c("random", "everything", "VI+TD-VI"),   table = c("annotations", "intervals", "merged", "all"),   include_all_tier_types = FALSE,   allow_annotation_errors = FALSE,   include_pi = FALSE )

title: Load VIHI annotation data — get_vihi_annotations
text: version version tag checkout subset pre-defined subset data loaded? 'random' (default) loads annotations 15 randomly sampled intervals recordings corpus. 'VI+TD-VI' loads annotations random top-5 high-volubility intervals VI recordings TD matches. 'everything' loads annotations tiers. Exercise caution option: data include incomplete unchecked annotations. table table return - annotations (default) intervals. merged, returns annotations table interval information merged . Intervals without annotations included. , returns named list tables.#' include_all_tier_types tier types included output? FALSE (default), tiers relevant subset returned. 'random' 'VI+TD-VI' subsets, relevant tier types : transcription, vcm, lex, mwu, xds. 'everything' subset, parameter ignored tier types returned. allow_annotation_errors case errors found annotations, function throw error (FALSE, default) add error_n columns annotations table? Use way inspect errors, way ignore . include_pi annotations marked PI included output? FALSE (default), filtered .

title: Load VIHI annotation data — get_vihi_annotations

Filter want . transcribed utterance can empty (”). Normally, means code interval segmented annotated. might stray utterance segments like . (relevant non-speaker TIERs ) Currently, way tell whether annotation missing segmented segmented yet annotated: represented NA. change future: missing segment still NA, missing annotation ”.

Please clone it.  vitd <- get_vihi_annotations(version='0.0.0.9006-dev.5', subset='VI+TD-VI',                              table='all') #> Error in run_git_command(repo, "fetch --tags --prune --prune-tags"): Expected to find the "vihi_annotations" repository at the following location: /home/runner/BLAB_DATA/vihi_annotations. what: Tag low-data trials based on fixation timeseries — tag_low_data_trials
title: Tag low-data trials based on fixation timeseries — tag_low_data_trials
text: Identifies marks trials insufficient data based proportion time points within specified time window contain valid data. trial considered "low-data" less min_fraction time window contains valid data.

title: Tag low-data trials based on fixation timeseries — tag_low_data_trials
code: tag_low_data_trials(   fixation_timeseries,   window_column = NULL,   t_start = NULL,   t_end = NULL,   t_step = 20,   min_fraction )

title: Tag low-data trials based on fixation timeseries — tag_low_data_trials
text: fixation_timeseries dataframe containing fixation timeseries data. must minimally contain following columns: recording_id: Identifier recording session. trial_index: Index identifier trial. is_good_timepoint: Logical vector indicating valid time points (TRUE FALSE). window_column provided: column name indicating time bins within window interest. Values "Y" "N". window_column (Optional) string specifying name column indicates (using factor label "Y") time bins belong window tested insufficient data. Either window_column t_start t_end must supplied. t_start (Optional) Numeric value specifying lower bound window interest milliseconds target onset. Must provided along t_end window_column supplied. t_end (Optional) Numeric value specifying upper bound window interest milliseconds target onset. Must provided along t_start window_column supplied. t_step time step milliseconds. Must match one used fixations_to_timeseries. min_fraction Numeric value 0 1 indicating minimum fraction window must contain valid data trial considered "high-data". example, min_fraction = 1/3 requires least one-third window valid data. parameter must specified.

title: Tag low-data trials based on fixation timeseries — tag_low_data_trials
text: input dataframe additional logical column is_trial_low_data, indicating whether trial considered low-data (TRUE) (FALSE).

title: Tag low-data trials based on fixation timeseries — tag_low_data_trials
text: Time points counted data meet following criteria: is_good_timepoint TRUE. column typically created condition like mutate(is_good_timepoint = some_condition). definition can vary studies. time bin within window interest, indicated window_column specified t_start t_end. Usage Requirements: Either window_column t_start t_end must supplied. window_column provided, function uses identify time bins within window interest. t_start t_end provided: function checks column named window_{t_start}_{t_end}ms exists fixation_timeseries. exists, function stops suggests using window_column = "window_{t_start}_{t_end}ms" instead. exist, function calls assign_time_windows() create required window column proceeds. temporary which_window_{t_start}_{t_end}ms column created assign_time_windows() dropped use. function calculates minimum number time points valid data required trial considered "high-data", based min_fraction duration time window (t_end - t_start). tags trial adding new column is_trial_low_data, TRUE low-data trials FALSE otherwise.

title: blabr 0.25.2
text: Fixes default folder name typo get_blab_share_path Changes get_blab_share_path check empty strings just NULL

title: blabr 0.25.2
text: Added add_vtc_speaker_stats function, thing get_vtc_speaker_stats keep original columns

title: blabr 0.25.1
text: Make blabr look git current PATH. Previously, path git looked package installation leading changes PATH effect .

title: blabr 0.25.0
text: window boundaries now specified two arguments: t_starts, t_ends instead t_start, short_window_time, med_window_time, long_window_time. DEFAULT_WINDOWS_UPPER_BOUNDS can used t_ends. windows columns now called “window_ms” “which_window_ms” instead , e.g., “shortwin” “whichwin_short”. window boundaries specifed explicitly, default values used. which_window_<t_start>_<t_end>ms columns now following values: “pre”, “neither”, “_ms” (latter used “short”/“med”/“long”) min_fraction must specified explicitly, default value 1/3 removed suggested error message. can now either specify window_column used t_start t_end removing confusing option existing window column used end t_start used calculation maximum number bins window. specify window column, boundaries inferred column name (see assign_time_windows).

title: blabr 0.24.1
text: Update get_reliability 0.0.4 version dataset.

title: blabr 0.24.0
text: Streamlined update_global_basic_levels. now loads all_basiclevel_NA.csv local file, BLAB_DATA. way, need create tagged commit all_basiclevel repo updated all_basiclevel_NA.csv doesn’t yet global basic levels. still need commit tag global basic level mapping dictionaries repo though.

title: blabr 0.23.0
text: Update column names types. Teach treat v2.0.0-dev.3 development version. get_* functions read data ~/BLAB_DATA longer make corresponding repos headless version commit already checked branch.

title: blabr 0.22.1
text: bug verify_no_overlapping_fixations internally used fixations_to_timeseries.

title: blabr 0.22.0
text: read_message_report function. split_fixation_repor, split_message_report, merge_split_reports functions together transform data fixation message report list tables: experiment, recordings, trials, fixations, messages. Use first step eyetracking processing.

title: blabr 0.22.0
text: eyetracking functions renamed updated. One notable difference expect input dataframe contain columns recording_id trial_index allow choose column parameter. Instead, use dplyr::rename necessary , better yet, keep two column names don’t rename . Functions split_fixation_report split_message_report create columns renaming RECORDING_SESSION_LABEL TRIAL_INDEX original report tables. now lot faster. example, processing time went 1+ min 1-3 s “ht_seedlings” dataset. keepCols parameter dropped, use dplyr::select instead. gaze, binSize, maxTime parameters now fixations, t_step, t_max. Otherwise, didn’t change. expects fixation boundaries t_start t_end columns. used split_fixation_report, named like already, otherwise use dplyr::rename. function throw error fixations overlap happened datasets past. output longer timeBin column (redundant easily confusable time), Nonset t_onset - time since target onset rounded nearest multiple t_step. fixations_report now read_fixation_report, parameter val_guess_max just guess_max now. now takes following parameters: fixation_timeseries, t_step (previously bin_size, t_start, short_window_time, med_window_time, long_window_time. input dataframe must contain target_onset column. nb_1 used take number time steps (bins) since target onset common window start replaced t_start takes time ms two events. changes function future mainly aimed making harder use one set window boundaries function different one tag_low_data_trials (previously FindLowData). now takes following parameters: fixation_timeseries, window_column, t_start, t_end, t_step, min_fraction (defaults 1/3). min_fraction makes minimum amount data explicit. nb_2 parameter replaced t_start meaning assign_time_windows. converting older code, nb_2 used ms, unlike nb_1 get_windows bins nothing convert. check t_start t_end correpond used assign_time_windows careful make sure match. output column now called is_low_data_trial always TRUE FALSE (used NA trials).

title: blabr 0.22.0
text: Example get_vihi_annotations uses data version doesn’t lead errors. whichwinmed whichwinshort columns output assign_time_windows (previously, get_windows) now calculated correctly. used identical whichwinlong bug.

title: blabr 0.22.0
text: Many eyetracking functions hard-deprecated favor renamed updated versions. described “Changed”. See help(blabr::defunct) full list. can also run get replacement suggestion. Removed RemoveLowData RemoveFrozenTrials. Use tag_low_data_trials FindFrozenTrials followed dplyr::filter() instead.

title: blabr 0.21.0
text: filters PI default, returns randomly sample intervals default, can return annotations random top-5 high-volubitlity intevals VI TD matches subset = 'VI+TD-VI', checks ACLEW tiers consistency, see ?get_vihi_annotations details.

title: blabr 0.21.0
text: Lots tests. still failing though.

title: blabr 0.20.1
text: Three new tiers: fun, pro, rep. Columns transcription annotation id now called transcription transcription_id.

title: blabr 0.20.0
text: Introduced get_seedlings_nouns_extra get_seedlings_nouns_codebook functions. get_seedlings_nouns loads main table now. get_seedlings_nouns friends now produce messages informing user existence codebooks, relation tables, etc. Dataset versions removed GitHub persisting locally longer loaded. Add get_blab_share_path, remove get_pn_opus_path.

title: blabr 0.20.0
text: help page get_seedlings_nouns updated. Check requested dataset versions present GitHub repo. Supplying non-existent versions get_* functions (get_seedlings_nouns, get_vihi_annotaitons, etc.) used lead loading version currently BLAB_DATA. Enforce column specification get_* functions: throw error doesn’t match data. Previously, messed didn’t add new columns code didn’t use specific dataset versions, indication . Fix column misspecification seedlings-nouns tables revealed enforcing column specifications. Add missing column specs get_vihi_annotations. Avoid repeating dataset version handling unnecessariliy resulting doubling reminder supply version function call update requested version. Throw error git command throws one.

title: blabr 0.19.1
text: unqualified calls get_vihi_annotations. don’t yet know wasn’t flagged devtools::check() didn’t cause test error.

title: blabr 0.19.0
text: Function get_vihi_annotations similar get_* functions.

title: blabr 0.18.1
text: Correctly identify public versions datasets.

title: blabr 0.18.0
text: Fix: - installation errors due missing tidyverse meta-package. - Now, neither packages tidyverse, packages attached running library(blabr). forces user insert explicit library(<pkg>) calls code leading fewer unintended consequences, e.g., filter referring dplyr::filter instead standard stats::filter even user didn’t run library(dplyr).

title: blabr 0.17.0
text: Features: - Switched public version get_seedlings_nouns. development versions can still requested. - Now, get_seedlings_nouns can get tables codebooks SEEDLingS - Nouns dataset table get_codeobook parameters. Fixes: - CONTRIBUTING.md - devtools::test() run devtools::check(). - Multiple tests don’t fail anymore. Except test-seedlings.R, one skipped now.

title: blabr 0.16.3
text: Fixes: - Take account global_bl already exists adding updated global_bl column “all_basiclevel_NA.csv”. - col_factor called without qualifying readr::.

title: blabr 0.16.2
text: Fix: correctly add global_bl column specification reading “all_basiclevel_NA.csv”.

title: blabr 0.16.1
text: Account adding global_bl column directly all_basiclevel.

title: blabr 0.16.0
text: Account csvs seedlings-nouns_private moved “public/” subfolder.

text: Account global basic level dictionaries moved all_basiclevel repo.

title: blabr 0.14.0
text: Add function get_seedlings_nouns loads seedlings-nouns dataset lab-private repo.

title: blabr 0.13.2
text: Switch Makrdown docs.

title: blabr 0.13.1
text: Bugfix: update big_aggregate reflect switch “TVS” “TVN” “speaker” value.

title: blabr 0.13.0
text: Improved handling segments spanning two intervals add_lena_stats make_five_min_approximation: segment contributes utterance counts intervals proportion overlap. change, make_five_min_approximation produces awc cvc test file differ corresponding lena5min csv file

title: blabr 0.12.0
text: New functions: prepare_intervals add_lena_stats previously used single function make_five_min_approximation. latter still exists calls former two now. changes behavior make_five_min_approximation: zero-duration intervals. Segments overlapping two intervals now count fully towards (previously count towards first one). Intervals returned time point recording (previously, intervals segments starting returned).

title: blabr 0.11.0
text: ambiguous words object_dict can’t rows NA disambiguate, specific instructions manual updates, copy object_dict annotations need disambiguating even dictionary need updated.

text: Add get_pn_opus_path function.

title: blabr 0.9.0
text: objects marked export roxygen comments exported. function blabr longer works, use blabr:::<function_name> tell lab technician.

text: Updated docs get_vtc_speaker_stats.

title: blabr 0.8.0

title: blabr 0.7.0

title: blabr 0.5.2

title: blabr 0.5.1
text: bugfix: get_seedlings_speaker_stats called multiple functions without specifying library:: part.

title: blabr 0.5.0
text: Added read_rttm/write_rttm functions read/write .rttm files Voice Type Classifier (VTC) creates. Added functions get_seedlings_speaker_stats, get_vtc_speaker_stats add stats set time intervals based Seedlings annotations VTC outputs respectively. Renamed get_speaker_stats get_lena_speaker_stats make stats source explicit.

title: blabr 0.4.6
text: LENA functions: calculate_lena_like_stats now outputs additional column interval_start_wav contains interval start number milliseconds start wav file, sample_intervals_* functions keep necessary columns input intervals_tibble: interval_start, interval_end, - case sample_intervals_with_highest - column whose values maximized.

title: blabr 0.4.5
text: Removed dependency fuzzyjoin BioConductor package IRanges - less problems installing blabr. VIHI LENA intervals annotation: prevent utterances counting towards two neighbouring intervals.

title: blabr 0.4.4
text: fix: sample_intervals_periodically works now

title: blabr 0.4.3
text: fix: correctly tell R install IRanges BioConductor

title: blabr 0.4.2
text: LENA: calculate stats, sample intervals several ways get LENA-like AWC, CTC, CVC stats given time intervals, get speaker-level stats: adult word count, total segment duration, child utterance count sample intervals: randomly, periodically, optimizing given metric

title: blabr 0.4.1
text: bugfix: lag now prefixed dplyr:: make_five_min_approximation, stats::lag used.

title: blabr 0.4.0
text: add make_five_min_approximation function processes .file outputs tibble columns duration, AWC.Actual, CTC.Actual, CWC.Actual similar ones LENA’s 5min.csv files, except different handling speech segments cross 5-min interval border: LENA splits values two intervals, consider belong first one.

title: blabr 0.3.0
text: get_* functions produce similar results “.csv” “.feather” now. attributes exactly orders factor levels different now outputs tibbles column types. similarity checked .equal(..., check.attributes = FALSE))

title: blabr 0.2.1
text: Suppress git message checking tag.

title: blabr 0.2.0
text: get_* functions branch commit parameters anymore, instead new version parameter currently refers tag label corresponding dataset repository. Using get_all_* functions without supplying version argument discouraged, appropriate warning place. Motivation change: explicitly setting dataset version gives one chance reproducible analysis, using versions instead commit hashes lets us later choose different non-git storage option. , even go git, old new hashes clash /confuse users. Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
